message_1: What will happen if a piece of copper metal is placed in a solution of silver nitrate? Write a balanced chemical equation to represent the reaction, and determine the products and their states.
message_2:
When a piece of copper metal is placed in a solution of silver nitrate, a single displacement reaction occurs. Copper displaces silver in the silver nitrate solution, forming copper(II) nitrate and silver metal. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

Cu(s) + 2AgNO3(aq) â†’ Cu(NO3)2(aq) + 2Ag(s)

The products of this reaction are copper(II) nitrate (Cu(NO3)2) in aqueous solution and solid silver (Ag) metal.
